title: Fully Vaccinated People Can Stop Wearing Masks in Most Settings, CDC Says
summary: People who have been fully vaccinated should still follow precautions in doctor's offices, airports and nursing homes, the agency recommends. Fully vaccinated people don't need to wear a mask or physically distance during outdoor or indoor activities, large or small, federal health officials said, the broadest easing of pandemic recommendations so far.

title: Canadian National Takes Lead in Bidding for Kansas City Southern
summary: Canadian railroad wins over Kansas City Southern by sweetening its $30 billion takeover offer. Canadian National Railway Co. took the lead in the race to acquire Kansas City Southern , which declared the railroad operator's roughly $30 billion takeover bid superior to a rival proposal.

title: Disney Adds Fewer Streaming Subscribers Than Hoped
summary: End of lockdowns and mask mandates is good news for parks segment but presents headwinds for 18-month-old streaming service. LOS ANGELES-The streaming boom that defined Hollywood during Covid-19 is slowing down for now.

title: The GOP's Post-Trump Trauma
summary: Can the party incorporate some of his political positions while moving past his poisonous style?. What is to become of the Republican Party? It will either break up or hold together. If the latter, it will require time to work through divisions; there will be state fights and losses as the party stumbles through cycle to cycle. But in time one side or general tendency will win and define the party. Splits get resolved when somebody wins big and nationally. Eisenhower's landslides in 1952 and '56 announced to the party that it was moderate. Reagan's in 1980 and '84 revealed it was conservative. The different factions get the message and follow the winner like metal filings to a magnet.

title: A Police Union Coverup in Boston
summary: What did Labor Secretary Marty Walsh know about a union chief charged with sexually abusing children?. Bostonians were shocked last summer when the former chief of the Boston police union, Patrick Rose, was arrested on 33 counts of sexually abusing children. The dismay has grown as it's become clear that Mr. Rose's behavior was known for years and that officials helped to keep it secret. That may have included Marty Walsh, the former union chief, former mayor of Boston and now U.S. secretary of Labor.

title: Randi Weingarten Sees the Light
summary: The teachers union chief finally says schools can open-next fall.. American Federation of Teachers President Randi Weingarten on Thursday hopped onto the caboose that has already left the station. "There is no doubt: Schools must be open. In person. Five days a week," the teachers' union chief declared in a speech.

title: Israel's Iron Dome Advantage
summary: Missile defense again shows its military and diplomatic benefits.. We've heard since the 1980s that missile defenses are a waste of money, but Israel keeps proving their value on the modern battlefield. The latest example is the success of Israel's Iron Dome missile-defense system in reducing casualties and damage from rocket attacks.

title: Biden's Rollback on Gig Work
summary: A Labor rule repeal to help unions will pinch contract workers.. Employers are struggling to find workers as the economy recovers, but the Biden Administration continues to make it harder. The latest blunder from Washington is the repeal of a Labor Department rule that made it easier for companies to hire contract-based workers.

title: Are Fannie and Freddie Ready for the Next Housing Crash?
summary: A new rule requires them to make 'living wills' for surviving a downturn without taxpayer bailouts.. This time last year, housing industry insiders were predicting that the market would collapse under the weight of the pandemic. The opposite happened. Even as the economy suffered its worst year since World War II, the housing market boomed.

title: End Comment Fraud at the Cost of a Stamp
summary: A modest plan would restore integrity to federal regulation.. The New York Attorney General's office announced an astonishing finding on May 6. Of the more than 22 million comments filed in response to the Federal Communication Commission's hotly contested 2017 "net neutrality" repeal, nearly 18 million were fraudulent. A 19-year-old computer science student filed nearly eight million of them using automated software.

title: Airbnb Has Mo Money, Mo Problems
summary: The company is expecting a travel rebound, but will likely need more hosts to meet demand. The pandemic supplied Airbnb with lots of problems, but returning demand isn't one of them.

title: The Justice Department's Resident Conspiracist
summary: Susan Hennessey's appointment suggests the department will be politicized again.. House Democrats in February stripped Georgia Republican Marjorie Taylor Greene of her committee assignments, punishment for promoting conspiracy theories. Democrats this week rewarded their own conspiracy theorist with a powerful position at the Justice Department. Anyone miss William Barr yet?

title: St. Junipero Serra, Founding Father
summary: The now-vilified friar offered a vision to overcome American acrimony.. The San Gabriel, Calif., Fire Department and Archdiocese of Los Angeles recently confirmed what many had long suspected: The fire that almost destroyed Mission San Gabriel Arcángel last year was arson. John David Corey Jr., 57, was charged with the crime last week and faces up to 14 years in prison if convicted.

title: 'Press Reset' Review: Surviving the Videogame Industry
summary: The business is rewarding but also volatile. Overwork and unstable employment are commonplace.. When it was launched in December, "Cyberpunk 2077" was one of the most eagerly anticipated videogames in years. The role-playing game takes place in Night City, a violent dystopia full of hackers and mercenaries, and actor Keanu Reeves has a starring role. But the game's developer, Poland-based CD Projekt Red, goofed the rollout. Players immediately reported that the game was plagued by glitches: characters randomly levitating, for instance. It emerged that, as "Cyberpunk" was heading toward release, staffers knew that it wasn't ready for prime time. Bugs were being discovered even as management declared that the game could be pressed to discs.

title: Notable & Quotable: GOP Civil War
summary: When 1980 began, an A-list New Year's gathering in Washington held an informal poll on who would win the presidential election that November. Not a single partygoer chose Reagan.. From "A GOP Civil War? Don't Bet On It" by Jeff Greenfield, Politico, May 12:

title: Vol. 34, No. 4: Headlines
summary: Most Popular News. The Wall Street Journal is one of the ever-decreasing number of news outlets that still uppercase most words in main headlines. Yes, we have lowercased headline decks since a policy change in 2015, but the main headlines are still traditional. In contrast, other publications have gone all-lowercase for the main headline, too, to present a more-casual feel.

title: Audit Watchdog Proposes Framework to Help Implement New Trading Ban
summary: The plan would help the PCAOB decide whether it can review or investigate an auditor in certain jurisdictions. The U.S. audit watchdog has proposed a new framework that would help it implement a law that bans foreign companies from the country's exchanges if their audits haven't been inspected by American regulators.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Sotheby's Invites a Chosen Few to Start Bidding Live Again
summary: The auction house invited roughly 50 collectors to its Manhattan saleroom dressed up by a set designer from 'Hamilton'. Los Angeles art adviser Susan Dishell felt a frisson of excitement and anxiety on Wednesday night as she gripped her white paddle-Number 832-and prepared to bid from her blue velvet seat in Sotheby's Manhattan saleroom. For the first time since the pandemic, Sotheby's invited a few dozen collectors and dealers to bid in person rather than by phone or online during live streamed auctions.

title: Military Justice Reaches Key Level of Support in Senate
summary: Gillibrand-Ernst bill would change how sexual assault and other serious crimes handled. WASHINGTON-A sweeping overhaul of the military justice system has earned the backing of 61 senators from both parties, clearing a critical threshold needed to advance the legislation after years of resistance from the Pentagon.

title: Biden Asks Republican Senators to Bring Him Reworked Infrastructure Proposal
summary: GOP Sen. Shelley Moore Capito said the group was encouraged after Mr. Biden asked for details, including how they would pay for spending. WASHINGTON-President Biden asked a group of Republican senators to flesh out their $568 billion infrastructure proposal with additional details, including how they would pay for it, a step that could begin more substantive negotiations on the issue.

title: DoorDash's Revenue Triples Amid Sustained Demand for Food Delivery
summary: Loss in the first quarter narrows but misses analysts' estimates. DoorDash Inc.'s revenue tripled in the first quarter, showing sustained demand for food-delivery services even as coronavirus vaccinations picked up and the nation moved toward reopening.

summary: Pair of delays come after mortgage insurer Enact shelved its own public debut on volatility concerns. Hearing-care services provider Hear.com NV and communication-technology company Zenvia Inc. postponed their initial public offerings due to the choppy stock market, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Smart & Final to Be Sold to Mexican Retail Giant
summary: Grupo Comercial Chedraui plans to buy the grocer for more than $600 million. Mexican retailer Grupo Comercial Chedraui SA agreed to buy grocer Smart & Final Stores LLC for more than $600 million, people familiar with the matter said, expanding its presence in a U.S. supermarket business that boomed during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: NYPD Officer Shot Three Times in Brooklyn, Released From Hospital
summary: The shooting marks the seventh time a New York City officer has been shot in the past six months. A New York Police Department officer was shot while searching for a suspect in a fatal shooting in Brooklyn on Wednesday night, marking the seventh time in the past six months that a New York City officer was struck by gunfire, police officials said.

title: Teachers Union Head Calls for Schools to Be Open Full Time This Fall
summary: Randi Weingarten, president of American Federation of Teachers, said schools should move toward full reopening despite risks. The president of one of the nation's largest teachers' unions said school should reopen five days a week this fall, pointing to improving conditions and the academic, emotional and social effects that more than a year of disrupted school have had on students.

title: Fed's Waller Says Inflation Jump Likely Temporary, Urges Patience
summary: Fed governor said officials need to see 'several more months of data' before determining when to adjust policy. WASHINGTON-The U.S. economy is "going gangbusters," but the Federal Reserve needs to see several more months of data on jobs and inflation before determining when to begin scaling back its easy-money policies, a central banker said.

title: New York City Begins Burial Plans for Bodies in Covid-19 Mortuary
summary: Investigators start final push to contact families of deceased who have been in freezer storage for months. New York City officials say they will soon begin interment plans for hundreds of bodies of people who died during the Covid-19 pandemic and have been stored for months-and in some cases a year-in freezer units in a temporary mortuary.

title: A Pipeline, a Public Official and a Private Jet
summary: The double standards of Michigan's Gov. Gretchen Whitmer.. Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm took to CNN this morning to assure a nervous public that "the gas is flowing" and now tweets that "it's a great relief that #ColonialPipeline Company is resuming full operations".

title: Coinbase Profit Surges in Exchange's First Report as Public Company
summary: Revenue and profit have largely been driven by the explosion in the popularity of bitcoin, other digital currencies. Coinbase Global Inc.'s profit surged in the first quarter, driven by a manic rally in bitcoin and other digital assets, the cryptocurrency exchange said in its first earnings report as a public company.

title: U.S. Stocks Rebound After Three-Day Selloff
summary: Technology stocks regain some ground after retreating earlier this week. U.S. stocks soared Thursday, chipping away at losses after suffering their worst three-day decline since late October.

title: 'Waiting for Godot' Review: Missing the Moment
summary: The New Group's unrelievedly bleak production of Samuel Beckett's classic starring Ethan Hawke and John Leguizamo would have felt more relevant at the beginning of the Covid-19 pandemic.. What plays were best suited to home viewing at the height of America's murderous pandemic? At first I hungered for the fizzing diversion of high comedy, but it turned out that what I really needed was deeply serious fare-though the play I most longed to see split the difference, a baggy-pants comedy about the meaninglessness of life that is one of the 20th century's greatest works of theatrical art. Yet for more than a year, no one seemed to have thought to webcast a staging of Samuel Beckett's "Waiting for Godot," ideal though it was to the occasion, not only because of its subject matter but because it calls for only a small cast (four men and a boy) and the simplest of sets (a tree by a lonely country road).

title: Airbnb's Bookings Improve, Revenue Recovers
summary: Net loss widens to $1.2 billion, driven by one-time costs. Airbnb Inc. reported more than $10 billion in bookings in the latest period while revenue recovered from the March 2020 quarter, when the pandemic devastated the travel industry.

title: 'The Underground Railroad' Review: A Fantasy of Freedom
summary: On Amazon Prime Video, director Barry Jenkins adapts Colson Whitehead's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel in a series both harrowing and beautiful.. In his 2016 novel, "The Underground Railroad," Colson Whitehead made a metaphor out of a metaphor, making the fabled fugitive-slave route of the antebellum South into a literal uptown subway, a mystery train to emancipation. He also made slavery into an allegory for slavery: His understanding with his reader was that no collection of facts could do justice to the history involved. But fantasy might.

summary: Once again welcoming visitors, a new automobile museum in Jacksonville, Fla., with an impressive collection of Millers, Porsches and more race cars was open for only seven weeks before Covid-19 hit.. Jacksonville, Fla.

summary: I've got beefs with the Rock 'n' Roll Hall of Fame and those 'best place to live' lists. Vote recounts are much in the news today, but there's no good reason they should be limited to politics. This is where Jethro Tull comes in.

title: The Hot Debate Over Solar Geoengineering and Its Impact on Climate
summary: In addition to cutting carbon emissions, is it time to study methods for altering the atmosphere? Three experts square off.. As concerns grow about how quickly the world can curb greenhouse-gas emissions, some scientists want to research an additional approach to the problem of global warming: solar geoengineering.

title: Judge Delays Former Officers' Trial in George Floyd Case
summary: Trial of three former Minneapolis police officers charged with aiding and abetting second-degree murder and manslaughter is delayed until March. A Minnesota judge delayed until March the trial of three former Minneapolis police officers charged with aiding and abetting second-degree murder and manslaughter when they helped Derek Chauvin restrain George Floyd.

title: David Cameron's Payday Preceded Greensill Capital's Collapse
summary: The former U.K. prime minister made several million dollars as an adviser to Greensill. He is now the subject of a government review into his role.. Former U.K. Prime Minister David Cameron was looking for his next act after leaving office in the shadow of the Brexit vote in 2016. He found it in Greensill Capital.

title: Canada's Trudeau Is Cleared in Ethics Probe
summary: Ethics watchdog said 'appearance of a conflict of interest' wasn't enough to find prime minister broke the law. OTTAWA-Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau didn't violate the country's conflict-of-interest laws when his Liberal government awarded a multimillion-dollar contract to a charity with financial ties with his family, according to the results of an investigation released Thursday.

title: Scientists Call for Deeper Investigation Into Covid-19 Origin
summary: A letter published in a leading academic journal criticizes the findings of a World Health Organization-led report. Prominent scientists are calling for a deeper investigation into the origin of Covid-19, including the possibility that a laboratory accident released the new coronavirus that caused the pandemic.

title: Slow-cooked Salmon With Ti Malice Sauce
summary: The tart, spicy sauce takes its name from a character in Haitian folklore.. To explore and search through all our recipes, check out the new WSJ Recipes page.

title: Modi Declared Victory, Then Covid Struck Back With a Vengeance
summary: The Indian leader's vanity, governing style and focus on politics made the crisis worse than it had to be.. Is Narendra Modi to blame for the carnage that Covid has wrought in India? It may be too soon to predict how voters will respond, but it's not too soon to assess the evidence. Any prime minister would likely have struggled to cope with the pandemic's brutal second wave, but Mr. Modi's overweening vanity, overly centralized style of governance, and relentless focus on electoral advantage made him particularly unsuited to the task. His Bharatiya Janata Party's Hindu nationalist ideology-which makes it loath to alienate "godmen" who are at odds with modern medicine-didn't help either.

title: No Gluten, Dairy or Refined Sugar? In These Recipes, You Don't Miss Them
summary: 'Top Chef' judge and newly minted cookbook author Gregory Gourdet on the magic of salt, his coconut obsession, the healing power of plants and the absolute best way to cook salmon. IT'S BEEN A BUSY year for Portland, Ore., chef Gregory Gourdet. For five months, at the height of the pandemic, he ran Kann, a Haitian-inspired pop-up and outdoor yurt village. He also entered a pod of 180 people to film the Portland-based 18th season of "Top Chef," in which he appeared not as a cheftestant, as he has in seasons past, but in the role of guest judge. Just this week, he published his first cookbook, "Everyone's Table: Global Recipes for Modern Health" (Harper Wave).

title: Amazon Adding 75,000 Workers
summary: The retail and tech giant said the new roles-representing nearly 8% of its U.S. workforce-are offering average pay of $17 an hour. Amazon.com Inc. is hiring 75,000 workers and offering $1,000 signing bonuses in some locations, the latest hiring spree in what has been a year of tremendous growth.

title: Bring Viewpoint Diversity to the Universities
summary: The left uses disparities in market participants (disparate impact) as proof of bias. Clearly there are huge disparities in the political leanings of university professors and administrators.. Regarding John Ellis's "Sorry, Prof, We're Cutting You Off" (op-ed, May 3): I have a simple solution to the problem of universities hijacking the traditional role of higher education. They made it political, so let's respond politically. One of the favorite bludgeons of the left is to use disparities in market participants as proof of bias (disparate impact). By this definition, clearly there are huge disparities (proof of bias, according to Democrats) in the political leanings of university professors and administrators-estimated at upward of 90% self-proclaimed Democrats.

title: Discourage Abuse at Traffic Stops: Cooperate
summary: During a traffic stop the cop is in control, but you set the tone.. Regarding Heather Mac Donald's "Anticop Movement Wants Road Anarchy Too" (op-ed, April 23): Politeness can go a long way during a traffic stop. The majority of cops are doing a very good job protecting the public. Many are understandably nervous. And why not? Too many of them are getting killed in the line of duty. Effective law enforcement must be a partnership between the citizens and the police.

title: McDonald's Raises Pay for U.S. Restaurant Workers
summary: Burger giant is boosting wages at company-owned stores as employers hunt for workers. McDonald's Corp. said it would raise pay for employees at company-owned restaurants in the U.S., one of the latest companies to bolster wages and benefits as they struggle to hire workers.

title: Fair Voting Is Antidote to Conspiracy Theory
summary: Do you think maybe Acorn "lost" my daughter's registration because she registered as a Republican?. Andy Kessler's comments in "No Thanks for the Feedback" (Inside View, April 26) are interesting, but I felt disrespected when he started in on election fraud, naming people like me conspiracy theorists. My experience with voter intimidation goes back many years. When I went to register to vote in my new state I was told to register as a Democrat if I wanted a job in the public school to which I had applied. During the Obama years the group Acorn "registered" my college-age daughter. When she showed up at her precinct to vote they told her she wasn't registered and therefore couldn't vote. Do you think maybe Acorn "lost" her registration because she registered as a Republican? I am sure many Republicans and Trump supporters have had or heard of similar experiences, so hearing about vote fraud from the man we respect for exposing the left's tactics was easy to believe and act on.

title: 2021 Ducati Multistrada: A Touring Bike With a Safer Ride
summary: This sporty bike includes a variety of Automatic Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS)-safety features widely available with cars but introduced here for the first time in a series-production motorcycle. I REGRET ever throwing a leg over the 2021 Ducati Multistrada V4 S ($24,695, as tested), the company's beguiling touring bike of unusual size, now equipped with adaptive cruise control and blind-spot detection. It filled my helmet with a lot of wrong thoughts, shameful thoughts, that years of therapy were supposed to cure. I again feel a love that dare not speak its name, around my house anyway: motorcycle.

title: Do Shareholders, Management Really All Agree on ESG?
summary: The beneficial owners of the companies cited have no say at all in how their institutionally held shares are voted.. Mitchell Seider makes a good point in his letter (May 7) about how shareholders and management must agree on what is good for the business because shareholders haven't complained. However, if you look at share ownership of Delta Air Lines , over 60% of the shares are owned by institutions with Delta directors and officers owning less than 1%. For Coca-Cola , over 67% of the shares are owned by institutions with directors and officers owning about 1%.

title: Home Economics Classes Empowered Me in Later Life
summary: I am constantly standing on my home-economics foundation.. Regarding Barbara Spindel's review of Danielle Dreilinger's "The Secret History of Home Economics" (Bookshelf, May 3): I have interacted with many young adults and frequently lamented the demise of home-economics classes in our high schools. It was always far more than cooking and sewing. It taught me about a variety of life skills. My own home-economics education led me to teaching, to family and child development, to running a preschool and owning two businesses. Whether it is the application of math to an interior-design challenge, learning some new technology, coaching other business owners, understanding finance or offering advice to grandchildren, I am constantly standing on my home-economics foundation.

title: Why the Colonial Pipeline Shutdown Is Causing Gas Shortages
summary: With few refineries of its own, the East Coast relies on gasoline, oil and jet fuel transported from the Gulf Coast. The attackers who hacked into Colonial Pipeline systems chose one of the most important segments of the U.S. energy infrastructure. The 5,500-mile pipeline, the largest in the U.S., carries gasoline and other products to 14 states and Washington, D.C., including nearly half of all fuel consumed on the East Coast. Colonial's shutdown has caused gasoline shortages in states in the Southeast serviced by the line, highlighting the pipeline's crucial role in U.S. energy distribution.

title: Student's Death in China Spurs Questions About Surveillance

summary: Furniture company Ethan Allen keeps getting mistaken for a cryptocurrency. We have all found money in the couch. Now people are mistaking a couch for money.

Images of buildings exploding in Gaza from Israeli airstrikes and the country's police storming Jerusalem's Al Aqsa mosque, the third holiest site in Islam, have catalyzed a wave of pro-Palestinian protests across the Middle East and beyond, testing the limits of Arab governments' relationships with Israel.

title: A Perfect Summer Road Trip in the Rocky Mountains
summary: This three-day drive through Colorado combines traffic-stopping vistas, wildflower meadows, arty small towns and a peach of a last leg. COUNTLESS MONUMENTAL acts of nature roost within the Rocky Mountains. If you're pressed for time but eager to gorge on scenic beauty and intriguing mountain towns, we've devised a three-day road trip setting out from Denver and ending in Grand Junction. A few pointers: Some of the best spots sit at the end of rocky roads; opt for four-wheel drive. Cellphone reception can't cross over every peak; make sure your maps are printed or downloaded in advance. This region can be highly seasonal; visit between now and the end of September before some places flip from bustling to boarded-up.

title: U.S. Jobless Claims Fall to Another Pandemic Low
summary: Claims now at lowest level since mid-March 2020, when pandemic shut down the economy. Jobless claims continued a several-week slide to new pandemic lows, in a sign hiring is primed to strengthen as workers return to the labor market.

title: Good Moods Often Lead to Bad Decisions
summary: Psychological research shows that judgment is surprisingly dependent on mood-and that being in a bad one has a silver lining. We've all noticed that our own judgments can depend on how we feel-and we are certainly aware that the judgments of others vary with their moods, too. A judge might impose a severe sentence on a criminal defendant in part because the weather is miserable outside. A doctor might decide to send a patient home rather than to order a battery of tests, in part because it is late in the afternoon and she is a bit tired. A corporate executive might decide to go forward with a risky project, in part because she had a wonderful weekend with her family.

title: Lawyer Tried to Keep Traumatized Students in School

They can't win without his voters, but they also will struggle to win if the former President dominates the party and insists on re-fighting the 2020 election for the next four years.

title: How Bad Was Trump-Biden 2020 Polling Miss? Worst in 40 Years
summary: Surveys overstated Democrats' support up and down the ballot, as some voters were less inclined to participate in polls. Public opinion surveys ahead of the 2020 presidential election were the most inaccurate in 40 years, according to an expert panel convened by the main trade group for pollsters, which said its work hadn't yet pointed to a way to correct the error.

title: U.K.'s Biggest Fleet in Decades to Flex Muscle With Eye on China, U.S.
summary: Fresh from Brexit, Britain bulks up military to strengthen special relationship with U.S.. LONDON-The most powerful U.K. fleet to be assembled in decades is preparing to set sail this month on a tour of 40 countries, focused on the Indo-Pacific, in an effort to show British military muscle in a region where the U.S. is seeking to counter Chinese influence.

title: Yelp Ramps Up Spending on Ad Products to Boost Revenue
summary: The business-listings firm looks to expand its offering for service businesses. Yelp Inc. is expanding its advertising tools to help plumbers, movers and other service providers connect with customers online as the business-listings company looks to grow after a pandemic downturn.

title: You've Lost the Bidding War on Your Dream Home. Enter the Five Stages of Grief.
summary: Resume Subscription. If you are trying to buy a house right now, you're in the middle of a real-life Hunger Games. You finally find that perfect little house that you can't live without, and there will be 13 other people who feel the same way.

title: Inflation Doesn't Have to Mean High Interest Rates
summary: Issues like the semiconductor shortage are pushing up prices. Investing in production can be a better way to deal with inflation than interest-rate rises.. Does inflation always lead to high interest rates? Washington's semiconductor ambitions point to a more logical policy response.

title: Vaccine Patent Waivers Deserve a Warning Label
summary: The move to suspend patents on Covid-19 vaccines opens up a major risk to the way the drug industry does business. The decision by the Biden administration to support a temporary waiver on patents for Covid-19 vaccines might not end up costing the drug industry a dime, but investors who make that assumption are playing a dangerous game.

title: SoftBank Pulls Back From Funding 'Nasdaq Whale'
summary: Unit at Japanese tech investor lost billions of dollars on derivatives trades tied to tech stocks. TOKYO- SoftBank Group Corp. is pulling back from an investment unit it set up last year whose bets on publicly traded technology stocks were so large they earned the Japanese investor the nickname "Nasdaq whale."

title: Dentsu Creates Unit to Boost Diversity in Media
summary: Veteran ad buyer Mark Prince to lead division that will consult with minority-owned media businesses and marketers seeking increasingly diverse audiences. Dentsu Inc. is launching a stand-alone division aimed at boosting diversity in the media industry by helping minority-owned companies grow and connecting them to ad buyers looking to direct more dollars to such firms.

title: China's People Problem: From Too Many to a 'Decline That Sees No End'
summary: Latest census results signal that Beijing faces the risk of declining growth unless it makes changes to policies discouraging births and immigration. The results of a once-a-decade census present China and its president, Xi Jinping, with a stark choice: Unwind party controls on family planning and immigration, or stick with the policies and risk declining economic growth.

title: NCAA Corporate Sponsorships Are for 90 Championships. They Revolve Around One.
summary: The NCAA handed over all sponsorship sales to CBS and Turner, which broadcast the men's basketball tournament. That could be leaving other sports behind.. Companies including AT&T Inc., Coca-Cola Co . and others together pay more than $200 million every year to associate their brands with the National Collegiate Athletic Association. Their sponsorship fees give them the exclusive right to associate with 90 NCAA sports championships.

title: Poshmark and RealReal's Half-Off Sale
summary: Online used-apparel sellers debuted on the public markets with much excitement but are priced more realistically now. The hype around online used-apparel sellers might have been too much. Investors should take a second look now that they are in the bargain bin.

title: Blood Expert Says He Found Why Some Vaccines Trigger Clots
summary: A scientist in Germany thinks he has found an answer as researchers around world examine AstraZeneca and Johnson & Johnson shots. Scientists world-wide are racing to understand why Covid-19 vaccines from AstraZeneca PLC and Johnson & Johnson are causing rare but potentially deadly blood clots.

title: With Busy Airports and Restaurants, U.S. Moves Closer to Full Reopening
summary: Increased Covid-19 vaccinations, lower case counts fuel broad rollback of restrictions. The return to a pre-pandemic normal in the U.S. is gaining speed.

title: Libor Replacement Race Heats Up
summary: Some analysts say multiple rate benchmarks are likely to emerge instead of just one. New contenders are emerging in the race to get rid of the London interbank offered rate by year-end.

title: Banks Plan to Issue Credit Cards to People With No Credit Scores
summary: Regulator had asked banks to brainstorm on how to make loans to people who have often been locked out from getting them. Some of the largest U.S. banks plan to start sharing data on customers' deposit accounts as part of a government-backed initiative to extend credit to people who have traditionally lacked opportunities to borrow.

title: TSA Pipeline Oversight Faces Scrutiny After Colonial Hack
summary: Agency lacks resources, expertise and authority to police cybersecurity, experts say. Lawmakers are demanding answers on how the Transportation Security Administration probes pipeline security, after a cyberattack on the East Coast's main conduit for fuel snarled the region's gasoline supply.

title: Surgeon General, Miranda Kerr Speak at Final Day of Festival
summary: Tech and retail executives from Twitch, Poshmark, Nordstrom and OnlyFans are set to appear on final day. Published May 13, 2021 5:30 am ET

title: When the World's Best-Performing Stock Market Takes a Dive
summary: The indiscriminate slump in Taiwan's stock market demonstrates that sometimes flows overwhelm fundamental analysis, an increasing risk as stock buyers take on more leverage. Taiwan boasts the best-performing stock market of any MSCI index in either the developed or emerging-market universe since the beginning of 2020. This week a sharp selloff brought it close to losing that crown.

title: Don McGahn Agrees to Testify About Events Described in Mueller Report
summary: Trump's ex-White House counsel reached a deal to testify before a House panel behind closed doors as part of a probe into potential obstruction of justice by the former president. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department and a House committee reached an agreement that will allow former Trump White House counsel Don McGahn to offer testimony about events described in special counsel Robert Mueller's 2019 Russia report.

title: FAA Approves Boeing 737 MAX Electrical Fixes
summary: Electrical problem has grounded more than 100 of Boeing's 737 MAX jets. Boeing Co. received approval from U.S. air-safety regulators for fixes to an electrical problem that has grounded more than 100 of its 737 MAX jets, the company and a Federal Aviation Administration official said, paving the way for airlines to return them to passenger service within days.

title: Consumer Prices Jumped as Economy Picked Up
summary: Index rose 4.2% from year earlier, biggest 12-month increase since the summer of 2008. Consumer prices surged in April by the most in any 12-month period since 2008, shaking investors although the data partly reflect a recovery that is picking up steam as the Covid-19 pandemic eases.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: From Lady Gaga to Bad Bunny: What to Know About Live Music's Return
summary: Five things to expect from big concerts and festivals in the U.S. this summer and beyond. When do big concerts return? It's a complicated picture right now as some musicians sell out shows and others postpone them yet again. Just last week, Travis Scott's fall Astroworld Festival sold out quickly, while Justin Bieber delayed his tour to 2022.

title: Out of Gas, Drivers Miss Work and Stress About Family Gatherings
summary: Colonial Pipeline shutdown leads to dry pumps and long lines at gasoline stations in the Southeast. People across the Southeast missed work and rearranged plans, as the shutdown of the largest U.S. fuel pipeline stretched into its fifth full day Wednesday.

title: Ethereum Luminary Makes $1 Billion Covid-19 Donation in Shiba Inu Coin
summary: Alternative cryptocurrency used in India aid contribution is piggybacking off popularity of dogecoin. Vitalik Buterin, co-creator of the crypto network Ethereum, donated more than $1 billion on Wednesday to a relief fund to combat the spread of Covid-19 in India.

title: House Republicans Oust Liz Cheney From Leadership for Defying Trump
summary: Party lawmakers vote to remove Wyoming congresswoman over her criticism of former President Donald Trump. WASHINGTON-Republicans ousted Rep. Liz Cheney from party leadership, sidelining a prominent critic of former President Donald Trump in a bid to preserve party unity as the GOP works to win back the House in the midterm elections.

title: Ellen DeGeneres to End Talk Show After Next Season
summary: The comedian says she will be looking for a new challenge after what will be the show's 19th season. Ellen DeGeneres said she will end her long-running daytime talk show after a nearly two-decade run that established the comedian as an iconic figure in television.
